001package Calibration_Demos;
002
003import java.awt.Color;
004import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
005import java.util.ArrayList;
006import java.util.List;
007
008import ij.IJ;
009import ij.ImagePlus;
010import ij.gui.Line;
011import ij.gui.OvalRoi;
012import ij.gui.Overlay;
013import ij.gui.Roi;
014import ij.io.LogStream;
015import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
016import imagingbook.calibration.data.zhang.CalibrationImage;
017import imagingbook.calibration.data.zhang.ZhangData;
018import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.Camera;
019import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.ViewTransform;
020import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
021import imagingbook.core.resource.ImageResource;
022
023
024/**
025 * This plugin projects opens an image stack containing the 5 Zhang
026 * test images, then outlines the positions of the observed image 
027 * points and finally projects the points of the calibration model
028 * using the calculated intrinsic camera parameters (same for all
029 * views) and the extrinsic parameters calculated for each view.
030 * All data are part of Zhang's demo data set that comes with the
031 * EasyCalib program. NO CALIBRATION is performed here!
032 * 
033 * Graphic elements are drawn as non-destructive vector overlays:
034 * BLUE circles: observed corner points (used for calibration).
035 * RED markers: projected model points (to validate parameters).
036 * - LOOK CLOSELY / ZOOM IN! 
037 * The complete stack with overlay can be saved as a TIFF file. 
038 * 
039 * @author W. Burger
040 * @version 2022/04/14
041 */
042public class Demo_Zhang_Projection_Overlay implements PlugIn {
043        
044        private static ImageResource resource = CalibrationImage.CalibImageStack_tif;   // = "CalibImageStack.tif"
045        
046        static double CircleRadius = 1.0;
047        static double CrossRadius  = 2.0;
048        static Color CircleColor = Color.blue;
049        static Color CrossColor = Color.red;
050        static double StrokeWidth  = 0.25;
051        
052        static boolean BeVerbose = false;
053        
054        static {
055                LogStream.redirectSystem();
056                PrintPrecision.set(6);
057        }
058        
059        public void run(String arg0) {
060                ImagePlus testIm = resource.getImage();
061                if (testIm == null) {
062                        IJ.error("Could not open calibration images!"); 
063                        return;
064                }
065                
066                int M = testIm.getNSlices();
067                Overlay oly = new Overlay();
068                
069                // plot the observed image points as circles:
070                Point2D[][] obsPoints = ZhangData.getAllObservedPoints();
071                for (int i = 0; i < obsPoints.length; i++) {
072                        int sliceNo = i + 1;
073                        for (Roi roi : makeCircleRois(obsPoints[i], CircleColor)) {
074                                roi.setPosition(sliceNo);       // associate overly with this slice (important)
075                                oly.add(roi);
076                        }
077                }
078                
079                // plot the projected model points as crosses:
080                Point2D[] modelPoints = ZhangData.getModelPoints();
081                Camera camReal = ZhangData.getCameraIntrinsics();
082                ViewTransform[] viewsReal = ZhangData.getAllViewTransforms();
083                
084                for (int i = 0; i < M; i++) {
085                        int sliceNo = i + 1;
086                        Point2D[] projPnts = camReal.project(viewsReal[i], modelPoints);
087                        for (Roi roi : makeCrossRois(projPnts, CrossColor)) {
088                                roi.setPosition(sliceNo);       // associate overly with this slice (important)
089                                oly.add(roi);
090                        }
091                }
092                
093                testIm.setOverlay(oly);
094                testIm.show();  
095        }
096
097        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
098        
099        List<Roi> makeCrossRois(Point2D[] pnts, Color lineCol) {
100                final double r = CrossRadius;
101                final double ofs = 0.5; // pixel offset (elements to be placed at pixel centers)
102                List<Roi> rois = new ArrayList<Roi>();
103                for (int j = 0; j < pnts.length; j++) {
104                        double x = pnts[j].getX();
105                        double y = pnts[j].getY();
106                        Line linX = new Line(x - r + ofs, y + ofs, x + r + ofs, y + ofs);
107                        Line linY = new Line(x + ofs, y - r + ofs, x + ofs, y + r + ofs);
108                        linX.setStrokeColor(lineCol);
109                        linY.setStrokeColor(lineCol);
110                        linX.setStrokeWidth(StrokeWidth);
111                        linY.setStrokeWidth(StrokeWidth);
112                        rois.add(linX);
113                        rois.add(linY);
114                }
115                return rois;
116        }
117        
118        List<Roi> makeCircleRois(Point2D[] pnts, Color lineCol) {
119                final double r = CircleRadius;
120                final double ofs = 0.5; // pixel offset (elements to be placed at pixel centers)
121                List<Roi> rois = new ArrayList<Roi>();
122                for (int j = 0; j < pnts.length; j++) {
123                        double x = pnts[j].getX();
124                        double y = pnts[j].getY();
125                        OvalRoi circle = new OvalRoi(x - r + ofs, y - r + ofs, 2 * r, 2 * r) ;
126                        circle.setStrokeColor(lineCol);
127                        circle.setStrokeWidth(StrokeWidth);
128                        rois.add(circle);
129                }
130                return rois;
131        }
132        
133}
